channel.title: Mediagazer
channel.description: Top news and commentary for media professionals from all around the web

item.title: ベトナム当局は、著名ジャーナリストであるチュオン・フイ・サン（別名フイ・ドゥック）を、最近のフェイスブックへの投稿が国家安全保障法に違反したとして逮捕した（Grant Peck/Associated Press）。
item.description:
Grant Peck / Associated Press:
Vietnamese authorities arrest Truong Huy San, aka Huy Duc, accusing the prominent journalist of violating a national security law for recent Facebook posts  —  Authorities in Vietnam announced Friday that they have charged prominent journalist and historian Truong Huy San with violating …

item.title: LinkedInは、EUへの苦情を受け、LinkedIn Groupsへの参加から得たデータに基づいてEUユーザーをターゲットにすることを広告主に許可しない（Paul Sawers/TechCrunch）
item.description:
Paul Sawers / TechCrunch:
LinkedIn will no longer allow advertisers to target EU users based on data obtained from their participation in LinkedIn Groups, following a complaint to the EU  —  LinkedIn has confirmed it will no longer allow advertisers to target users based on data gleaned from their participation in LinkedIn Groups.

item.title: Xは依然として政治に関心の高い人々に人気があり、DCのインサイダーはしぶしぶ青い小切手を買い、候補者は安い広告費を払っている（NOTUS）
item.description:
NOTUS:
X remains a popular destination for people highly engaged in politics, with DC insiders reluctantly buying blue checks and candidates paying for cheap ads  —  While former President Donald Trump was actively being convicted by a jury of his peers in New York City last week …

item.title: ニューヨーク・タイムズ紙、2024年1月に公開されたGitHubトークンを使って盗まれた社内ソースコードとデータが4chanに流出したことを確認（Lawrence Abrams/BleepingComputer）
item.description:
Lawrence Abrams / BleepingComputer:
The New York Times confirms its internal source code and data leaked on 4chan after being stolen using an exposed GitHub token in January 2024  —  Internal source code and data belonging to The New York Times was leaked on the 4chan message board after being stolen from the company's GitHub repositories …

item.title: WaPoの未来の編集長ロバート・ウィネットが英国で使った手法。政府機関の仕事に記者を潜入させたり、情報源に10万ポンド以上を支払ったりした（Corbin Bolies/The Daily Beast）。
item.description:
Corbin Bolies / The Daily Beast:
A look at the methods future WaPo editor Robert Winnett used in the UK, including sending a reporter undercover to a government job and paying a source £100K+  —  RAT BOY'S TRAP  —  Rob Winnett, a U.K. journo vet is set to take over WaPo in the fall.

item.title: WaPoのウィル・ルイスCEO：電話ハッキングの隠蔽以外なら何でも聞いてくれ（Corbin Bolies/The Daily Beast）
item.description:
Corbin Bolies / The Daily Beast:
WaPo CEO Will Lewis: Ask Me Anything Except About That Phone Hack Cover-Up  —  DON'T ASK, DON'T TELL  —  Will Lewis has dragged WaPo into his alleged U.K. hacking scandal—and staffers who spoke with The Daily Beast are pissed. … An email landed in Washington Post staffers' inboxes …

item.title: ワシントン・ポスト紙の最近の危機は、CEOのウィル・ルイスがメディアの運営方法を理解していないことを示唆している。
item.description:
Jack Shafer / Politico:
The recent crisis at The Washington Post suggests that CEO Will Lewis has no idea how the media operates, and his fast-growing credibility problem may undo him  —  The crisis at the newspaper suggests the publisher has no idea about how the media operates.  —  The oldest axiom in journalism …

item.title: NY州、俳優の声や肖像が同意なしにデジタル複製されるのを防ぐ法案を可決、ホーチュル州知事の署名待ち（Sharon Knolle/The Wrap）
item.description:
Sharon Knolle / The Wrap:
NY passes legislation that would protect actors' voices and likenesses from being digitally replicated without consent; the bill awaits Gov. Hochul's signature  —  “[These are] the most essential parts of who we are and the work we do,” SAG's Rebecca Damon says of the Digital Contracts Act

item.title: WaPoのウィル・ルイスCEOとマット・マレー編集長は、スタッフを安心させようとするメモを送り、パティ・ストーンシファー前CEOは、1週間の騒動の後、ニュースルームを訪問した（ニューヨーク・タイムズ）。
item.description:
New York Times:
WaPo CEO Will Lewis and top editor Matt Murray send memos trying to reassure staff, and former CEO Patty Stonesifer visits the newsroom, after a week of tumult  —  Will Lewis, the chief executive, pledged to employees to ‘improve how well I listen,’ while Matt Murray, the new editor, tried to reassure staff members.

item.title: AI検索エンジン「Perplexity」が、フォーブスなどの記事の一部を、ほぼ同じ文言と不十分な帰属表示で「Pages」機能に再掲載している。
item.description:
Forbes:
AI search engine Perplexity is republishing parts of stories by Forbes and others, with nearly identical words and inadequate attribution, on its Pages feature  —  The startup, hailed as an AI-focused Google challenger, is republishing parts of exclusive stories from multiple publications …

item.title: 米デジタル広告訴訟、グーグルは陪審裁判を受けないと判事が判断（Mike Scarcella/Reuters）
item.description:
Mike Scarcella / Reuters:
Judge rules Google will not face jury trial in US digital ads case  —  Alphabet's (GOOGL.O) Google will not face a jury trial over its alleged digital advertising dominance after the company paid $2.3 million to cover the U.S. government's claim of monetary damages, a federal judge ruled on Friday.

item.title: グーグルの広告ビジネスに関する反トラスト法裁判で、陪審員ではなく裁判官が評決を下すことになった。
item.description:
Matthew Barakat / Associated Press:
A judge, not a jury, will give the verdict in the antitrust trial about Google's ad business, after Google paid $2.3M to cover US government's monetary damages  —  A judge rather than a jury will decide whether Google violated federal antitrust laws by building a monopoly on the technology that powers online advertising.

item.title: 情報源TNTスポーツの本拠地であるWBDが、全仏オープンの米国での放映権を10年間6億5000万ドルで獲得、ケーブルネットワークとマックスでの放映を計画（Andrew Marchand/New York Times）
item.description:
Andrew Marchand / New York Times:
Sources: WBD, home of TNT Sports, strikes a $650M deal for US rights to the French Open for 10 years, with plans to air the event on cable networks and Max  —  Warner Bros. Discovery has a 10-year, $650 million deal in place to be the new home of the French Open in the United States beginning in 2025 …

item.title: グーグル、カナディアン・ジャーナリズム・コレクティブと、同社が2023年にカナダのニュース会社に約束した1億カナダドルの分配契約を締結（Mickey Djuric/The Canadian Press）
item.description:
Mickey Djuric / The Canadian Press:
Google signs a deal with The Canadian Journalism Collective to distribute the CA$100M the company has promised to Canadian news companies in 2023  —  Google names group to dole out $100M to news  —  OTTAWA - Google announced which organization it has selected to distribute the $100 million …

item.title: TikTok、CNNとソニーのアカウントがハッキングされた欠陥を修正したことを確認（Sam Sabin/Axios）
item.description:
Sam Sabin / Axios:
TikTok confirms that it has fixed a flaw that let the accounts of CNN and Sony be hacked  —  - TikTok confirmed to Axios that the unidentified hackers were able to take over CNN's account.  — Reports suggest that they also attempted to hijack Paris Hilton's TikTok account.
